meanings.definition: The opening at the end of the digestive tract in some invertebrates.
meanings.sent1: The proctodaeums of insects serve as the exit point for waste.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the proctodaeums of various invertebrates to understand their digestive systems.
meanings.sent3: The ant joked that the proctodaeums of the caterpillar were like tiny back doors.
meanings.sent4: In the garden, the proctodaeums of the earthworms were like tiny trapdoors to another world.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a model to show the students where the proctodaeums are located in a grasshopper.

meanings.definition: The posterior part of the alimentary canal in certain animals.
meanings.sent1: The proctodaeums of birds are essential for eliminating waste from their bodies.
meanings.sent2: Vets often check the proctodaeums of pets during routine examinations.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper chuckled as she cleaned the proctodaeums of the monkeys.
meanings.sent4: The proctodaeums of the fish seemed like tiny gates to the underwater world.
meanings.sent5: The children were amazed to learn about the proctodaeums of different animals during their zoo visit.
